Title.evidence: Current diagnostic methods for bacterial infections in critically ill patients, including ventilator-associated pneumonia (VAP), are time-consuming, while empirical antibiotic therapy contributes to rising resistance.

Participants.evidence: 21 clinical isolates (derived from BAL samples of VAP patients)

Objective.evidence: This study expands knowledge of Escherichia coli metabolism by identifying VOCs produced by both multidrug-resistant and susceptible strains, characterizing their temporal profiles during growth, and assessing VOC profile changes after imipenem exposure.
